Comment.val: /*Xml-document (Initialized Datasource) containing roo an header information*/
/* Number of lines to keep.*/
A XML-Document
name of the element. In the output this will be enclosed with tag open en close characters.
When true <\elementname> is appended when false <elementname>
/*The root-element of the document*/
/*Location of the namespaces*/
/*Alias used*/
/*The XSD-information*/
Function Component FC
This component provides user defined functions. Only functions completely indempent of othe components, or datasources are allowed in this component.

/* Function to get the xml-header (root, namespace, schemalocation an xmlBlob. Basicly the standard close tag of the root-element will be removed. If a linecount>0 is given more lines of the header (ea standard first element ) will remaijn. Take good care. There is no intelligence in this function. When a reloaded schema provides more elements for the first element. the call to this function has to be adjusted.
See also initializeXml: This function enable to create a xml-document from scratch, without the use of a datasource*/

Function to get the xml-header (root, namespace, schemalocation an xmlBlob. Basicly the standard close tag of the root-element will be removed. If a linecount>0 is given more lines of the header (ea standard first element ) will remain. Take good care. There is no intelligence in this function. When a reloaded schema provides more elements for the first element. the call to this function has to be adjusted.
Use writeElement to close the the document.
See also initializeXml: This function enable to create a xml-document from scratch, without the use of a datasource
A blob containing the start of an xml-document
/*function to write the open or close tag of an element */
function to write the open or close tag of an element.
A blob containing the input with the elementtag appended.
/*function to write one or more simple elements (<tag>value</tag> max length for now restricted to 1000 chars. To avoid whitespace content is written on lines of 250, 500, or 1000 max */

Function to append one or more simple elements (<elementName>value</elementName>. Maximum length of the content for now restricted to 1000 characters. The function provides a mechanism pt prevent to much whitespace. Content is written on lines of 250, 500, or 1000 max
A blob containing the input with the content appended.
/*Implements the same functionality as the rp-program FUNC-AddStandardNamespace */
Implements the same functionality as the rp-program FUNC-AddStandardNamespace. Function uses internaly XPA-XMLfunctionality and will be slow on large documents.
A xml-document with xsi-namespace included.
/*Initializes an empty blob as an exml-document*/

Initializes an empty blob. With root-node, namespaceLocation and prefixes for the root-element itself, the responsebase (may be overwritten) and the standard xsi-namespace. Als set the XSD-information.
The initialized XML-document. This is a xml-document missing the endtag,

Copy of the same function in the E2-component. Take notice when FC is loaded later then E2 this variant is used.
This fuction set the internal character user as decimal and thousand-separator. Take care to reset
True when the decimal separator is changed, false when nothing changed.

ExpSyntax.val: FlwMtr ('Error occurred while creating XML! Code: '&Trim ({0,1}),'FALSE'LOG)

EVNT.Comment: /*Internal event to log problems encounter whie writing xml.*/
